ygData.subject: RE: Effects of AGI
ygData.msgSnippet: I would like to know if there is significant benefit to agi and dex above 120 and 130 levels - compared to 100-110.  With drum and chant, my dex goes to like
ygData.messageBody:
I would like to know if there is significant benefit to agi and dex above
120 and 130 levels - compared to 100-110. With drum and chant, my dex goes
to like 160 (ya, I have some really insane stat boosting jewelry.)

Sylly Songsynger
Bard of the 30th song
<Spirit of the Moon>
somewhere on Innoruuk


-----Original Message-----
From: Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4
[mailto:g4mntofcr@...]
Sent: Friday, October 01, 1999 3:38 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: [eqbards] Effects of AGI

From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4"
<g4mntofcr@...>

FYI. Just read the following on the E'ci board at EQVault.
The poster got
it off a monk website.

Galtin of E'ci

There was just a post on the monk board where someone used
the log programs
to test combat against 10 DW Caimans with 93 AGI and again
with 107 AGI.
While most of the numbers were within general tolerances,
average Dodges per
fight went from 0.4 to 1.0, and average Blocks per fight
went from 1.4 to
2.4. Also, the mob's hit/miss ratio dropped from 48% to 44%,
which is not
surprising.
So I'm taking this as evidence that there IS an AGI boost to
Dodge and Block
(at least for monks, but probably for everyone), and likely
for Parry as
well. If anyone's skeptical, well, you can type /log as well
as any of us..
